alert.note: Alert for Madison (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 23 at 6:31AM CST until February 24 at 1:30PM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Alabama... Flint River at Brownsboro affecting Madison County. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Flint River at Brownsboro. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Water begins to flood yards on the downstream side of the Brownsboro Road bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 18.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:30 AM CST Wednesday was 18.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.5 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.4 feet on 03/18/2002. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
